subject: Switch your career to Artificial Intelligence with  your existing maths knowledge. Only 99 USD.
snippet: Switch your career to Artificial Intelligence with only your existing maths knowledge. Limited offer - only 99 USD. Countdown Institute Limited promotional offer – additional monthly zoom mentoring
content:
[

** Switch your career to Artificial Intelligence (https://countdowninstitute.com/) with only your existing maths knowledge. Limited offer - only 99 USD. ------------------------------------------------------------ https://countdowninstitute.com/ Limited promotional offer – additional monthly zoom mentoring sessions. Sign up now for only 99 USD. (https://countdowninstitute.com/) The Mathematical Foundations of Data Science course empowers you to learn machine learning and deep learning (Artificial Intelligence – AI) based on your high school maths concepts. We help you to switch your career towards AI using your existing maths knowledge. Machine learning and Deep Learning are complex concepts, but you can learn them by ‘joining the dots’ back to your high school maths. What do we mean by that? Essentially, until age 17-18, you learn four components (at least partially) i.e. * Probability Theory * Statistics * Linear Algebra and * Optimization These concepts are undoubtedly familiar to you if you have studied a maths/ science-based bachelors or engineering program. These four ideas also underpin machine learning and deep learning. Our work aims to bridge the gap between these high school maths concepts and data science (which is a collective term for machine learning and deep learning). The course is created by Ajit Jaokar – who teaches AI at the University of Oxford and LSE. The course is not affiliated to any academic institution. How did this approach originate? I first developed these ideas when I taught my AI courses at the University of Oxford. As a teacher, I noticed that industry professionals often find it easier if I could co-relate complex ideas to simpler concepts. Especially if they already knew these concepts (even if they had learned them 10 or 20 years ago!). Hence, I spend a lot of time 'connecting the dots.' Note that this course is not related to any academic institute I am associated with. Why is this approach unique? Instead of AI, let’s talk instead of Elon Musk! Elon Musk talks of first principles thinking. That means you boil down a process to its fundamental parts and work backward through each building block to connect to the essential elements. This approach needs more in-depth thinking but provides for deeper learning. In other words, first principles thinking is the act of identifying the fundamental parts that you know are true and building up from there. When applied in this context (learning AI), we can connect complex ideas to simple ones, especially to ideas you already know. You may have tried to learn Machine learning and Deep Learning previously with limited success. In my experience of teaching machine learning and deep learning, three problems inhibit effective learning. Often, these are missed by industry practitioners but are all too familiar to teachers - especially if they teach in class (face to face) * Cognitive dependencies - ideas depend on other ideas that need to be explained first. * Cognitive overload - there is too much information. Most of it is good. But you don’t know in which sequence to approach the topic. * First-principles thinking – i.e., how things tie back to each other. If these ideas resonate with you, you have come to the right place! Details of Topics and modules We have two categories of modules: AF modules (AI fundamentals modules) and MF modules (Maths foundations modules). In the AI Foundations modules, we first understand machine learning and deep learning in detail, assuming you have had no previous exposure to machine learning or deep learning. We then explore the ten maths foundations modules as below. In each case, we start with a concept you are likely to be already familiar with at the high school level (ex: the equation of a straight line) and then connect it to more complex machine learning or deep learning ideas. You will cover the following modules: (note the order of modules could change) Mathematics of machine learning: We start off with Linear algebra and the equation of a straight line. We relate it to perceptrons and multi-layer perceptrons. Functions and mathematical modeling – In this module, we explore machine learning and deep learning as functions relating them to maths Probability and inference: An exploration of probability theory and how it relates to inference The maths of deep learning: An exploration of gradient descent and backpropagation from a maths perspective Maths techniques used in feature engineering: Many maths techniques are used in feature engineering. In this section, we explore feature engineering and co-relate these ideas to maths. Model evaluation: An analysis of model evaluation A taxonomy of algorithms: We look at a technique to classify algorithms from a maths standpoint by considering the sample space or instance space Unsupervised learning: Unsupervised techniques including generative methods Bayesian approaches: In this module, we explore Bayesian approaches from a maths standpoint. A recap of ideas: In this concluding module, we recap all the ideas we have learned. Why now and what you get * The total price is 99 USD + taxes as applicable * If you sign up now, as a limited promotional offer – we offer monthly zoom mentoring sessions for the group (once a month). * Sign up now for only 99 USD. * When you sign up, you get the AI foundations modules - the next third in the next month and final third month after (spanning Sep Oct Nov Dec) * You get lifetime access to content and videos. * You can post questions online, which I can answer - however, considering the accessible price point – responses will not be instant. But I will respond to all questions related to the course within the week. * The material is based on my prior teaching offline (but we are not affiliated to any educational institution) * I intend to keep this group small and selective so that we can learn from it. * This pricing is a fixed cost, and it's intentionally low to keep the material accessible globally. There are no extras. Register now for only 99 USD (https://countdowninstitute.com/) This email was sent to Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com (mailto:Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com) why did I get this? Reservoir Rd . Brookline, MA 02467 . USA

]

Sept. 2, 1:00 - 2:30 p.m. ET. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ View as a web page (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/email/2020/q3/statistically-speaking/75335.html) https://www.jmp.com?utm_source=headerlogo&utm_medium=email https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty ** Virtual Event With Data Visualization Experts ------------------------------------------------------------ Join us on Sept. 2 to learn about the power of good data and information visualizations, backed by statistics and best practices, to make breakthrough discoveries and transcend communication barriers. Register now (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty) ** Watch the keynote ------------------------------------------------------------ Jonathan Schwabish, Founder, PolicyViz, is an economist, writer, teacher and creator of policy-relevant data visualizations. He is considered a leading voice for clarity and accessibility in how researchers communicate their findings. In his most recent book, Elevate the Debate: A Multilayered Approach to Communicating Your Research, Schwabish and his colleagues help people develop a strategic plan for communicating their work across multiple platforms and channels. https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty ** Tune in to see: ------------------------------------------------------------ * Mapping the right graph to the right problem. * Ways to improve graphicacy and data savvy at your organization. * How to gain momentum for your ideas with shared data visualizations. * And more. ** Watch the panel ------------------------------------------------------------ Join us for a discussion about how to use best practices in data visualization to democratize data access and analysis, and to increase data literacy and graphicacy at your organization. You'll hear from Jonathan Schwabish and: https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty ** Tim Chartier ------------------------------------------------------------ Professor of Mathematics and Computer Science, Davidson College https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty ** Court Sandau ------------------------------------------------------------ President and Owner, Chemistry Matters ** Who should attend? ------------------------------------------------------------ Scientists, engineers and researchers who want to gain momentum for ideas and communicate about data in an accessible, influential way. ** Details ------------------------------------------------------------ Sept. 2 | 1:00 - 2:30 p.m. ET Register now (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/statistically-speaking/events/sep-2/live-stream.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ss7013Z0000021wdTQAQ&utm_content=thirdparty) https://www.facebook.com/JMPsoftware https://twitter.com/JMP_software https://www.linkedin.com/company/jmp https://www.youtube.com/user/JMPSoftwareFromSAS Don't miss JMP updates: Please add jmp.com and sas.com as domains to your safe sender (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/about/email-safe-sender.html?utm_source=footerlink&utm_medium=email) list. subject: BEACON, a Data Thought Leadership Series from Google Cloud
snippet: BEACON, a Data Thought Leadership Series from Google Cloud, Sep 15-16 BEACON, a Data Thought Leadership Series from Google Cloud A digital data event from Looker, part of Google Cloud On September 15
content:
[

BEACON, a Data Thought Leadership Series from Google Cloud, Sep 15-16 https://looker.com/events/beacon/north-america-part2?utm_source=onlineevents&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=7012R000000g30l&utm_term=noram&utm_content=beacon_KDNuggets ** A digital data event from Looker, part of Google Cloud ------------------------------------------------------------ On September 15 & 16, we’re bringing BEACON back. Bigger and bolder, this time around we’re ready to bring you even more of the knowledge you need to become data-driven - direct from data professionals across various companies and disciplines. BEACON is a one-of-a-kind data experience, designed to introduce you to the tools and proven methods that will help you to find true power in your data. Over the course of our two-day digital event, you’ll pick up actionable insights from leading industry experts. Click here to see our agenda and speakers (https://looker.com/events/beacon/north-america-part2?utm_source=onlineevents&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=7012R000000g30l&utm_term=noram&utm_content=beacon_KDNuggets) , and sign up today. subject: Want to become an expert in putting ML in production? Check out the modeling melting pot.
snippet: Do you want to become an expert in putting Machine Learning in production? Check out the modeling melting pot. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ View as a web page SAS Model Management - A modeling melting pot
content:
[

Do you want to become an expert in putting Machine Learning in production? Check out the modeling melting pot (https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190009) . ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ View as a web page (https://www.sas.com/en_be/email/2020/q3/template-modeling-melting-pot-overall-story.html) https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190009 Do you want to become an expert in putting Machine Learning in production and looking to learn more about the topic? A modeling melting pot gives organizations the freedom to use their tools, algorithms and programming languages to develop and deploy analytical models - fueling innovation and creativity. Structure, standardization and coordination are key to turn the modeling melting pot into business value and smarter decisions. https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190010 We have curated an e-book of best practices on ML in production presented during the 2020 SAS Global Forum - Mastering the Model Lifecycle Orchestration Journey: A practical guide for Data Scientists, IT/DevOps and Business Analysts. (https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190010) https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190011 The on-demand webinar "How to automate modeling, deployment and governance at scale" (https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190011) demos the modeling melting pot at scale. Please visit our modeling melting pot site (https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190009) and view the ebook and webinar. Get started (https://www.sas.com/gms/redirect.jsp?detail=GMS137295_190009) Regards, SAS Data Science Team https://www.facebook.com/SASsoftware https://www.twitter.com/SASsoftware https://www.linkedin.com/company/sas About this email: SAS and all other SAS Institute Inc. product or service names are registered trademarks or trademarks of SAS Institute Inc. in the USA and other countries. ® indicates USA registration. Other brand and product names are trademarks of their respective companies. Copyright © SAS Institute Inc. All rights reserved. subject: Ray: Scalable, distributed ML & Python—serverless done right
snippet: View this email in your browser Ray, the open source Python framework for scaling distributed applications, is growing fast. Ray Summit Virtual is your chance to connect with the Ray community and see
content:
[

View this email in your browser (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=df957d0634&e=bfdfd73c17) https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=0bdf7b29cb&e=bfdfd73c17 Ray, the open source Python framework for scaling distributed applications, is growing fast. Ray Summit Virtual (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=19472bc84e&e=bfdfd73c17) is your chance to connect with the Ray community and see how organizations are already using it in production for scaling ML and Python applications. * Learn from top minds in ML & AI (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=ac45630bbe&e=bfdfd73c17) : Oriol Vinyals (Google DeepMind), Michael Jordan (UC Berkeley), Manuela Veloso (JP Morgan), Zoubin Ghahramani (Uber), David Patterson (Turing Award Winner) * See how companies are using Ray for ML infrastructure, process optimization, MLOps, deep learning, and other industrial applications * Learn all about the ML libraries that are built or rely on Ray (RLlib, Tune, Serve, RaySGD, spaCy, Hugging Face, Seldon) * Find out how Ray does serverless right—highly scalable, highly available, distributed ML all in the cloud Don't miss out—see for yourself why Ray is poised to be the dominant framework in distributed computing. Register & save your spot (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=85b0ebb040&e=bfdfd73c17) https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=3fd916e01e&e=bfdfd73c17 https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=795a068456&e=bfdfd73c17 ============================================================ ** Twitter (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=1c7736bb1a&e=bfdfd73c17) ** Facebook (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=ec4d1b3161&e=bfdfd73c17) ** Website (https://kdnuggets.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=4f2891ebb155b23f120ece0bd&id=4c48fe2243&e=bfdfd73c17) This email was sent to Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com (mailto:Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com) why did I get this? subject: Using Free-form Text to Build Better Predictive Models
snippet: Learn how to combine text data with non-text data to build better models and make better decisions. View as a web page JMP | Statistical Discovery. From SAS. Technically Speaking A predictive model is
content:
[

Learn how to combine text data with non-text data to build better models and make better decisions. View as a web page (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/email/2020/q3/technically-speaking/75157.html) https://www.jmp.com?utm_source=headerlogo&utm_medium=email https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/ondemand/technically-speaking/leveraging-free-text-data-to-build-better-models.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=advertisement&utm_campaign=ts7013Z000002vWnOQAU A predictive model is only as good as the data used to build it. Many organizations are missing out on important opportunities to improve model performance because they're ignoring important data - namely text data. By some estimates, more than 80% of the data generated in organizations is in the form of free text data - less than 1% of which is effectively analyzed. In this 30-minute webinar, Ross Metusalem (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/bios/metusalem-ross.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=advertisement&utm_campaign=ts7013Z000002vWnOQAU) demonstrates how text data can be combined with non-text data to build better models and make better decisions. Register to watch Ross discuss: * Examples from multiple industries of the potential value of augmenting models with text data. * How to mine text data for important features and summarize those features numerically so that they can be incorporated as factors in models. * A case study that compares model performance with and without the variables obtained through text mining. Who should attend? Anyone interested in learning how to mine information from text data and use that information as input into a predictive model to make the predictions of that model more accurate. Register now (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/events/ondemand/technically-speaking/leveraging-free-text-data-to-build-better-models.html?utm_source=kdnuggetseb&utm_medium=advertisement&utm_campaign=ts7013Z000002vWnOQAU) https://www.facebook.com/JMPsoftware https://twitter.com/JMP_software https://www.linkedin.com/company/jmp https://www.youtube.com/user/JMPSoftwareFromSAS Don't miss JMP updates: Please add jmp.com and sas.com as domains to your safe sender (https://www.jmp.com/en_us/about/email-safe-sender.html?utm_source=footerlink&utm_medium=email) list. About this email: If you do not wish to receive future emails, please modify your email preferences (https://www.jmp.com/optout?utm_source=footerlink&utm_medium=email) . To contact JMP via postal address: SAS Institute Inc., JMP Software, SAS Campus Drive, Cary, NC 27513 USA ATTN: Legal Division/Privacy Manager. SAS and all other SAS Institute Inc. product or service names are registered trademarks or trademarks of SAS Institute Inc. in the USA and other countries. ® indicates USA registration. Other brand and product names are trademarks of their respective companies. Copyright © SAS Institute Inc. All rights reserved. subject: Free eBook: Accelerating Spark 3
snippet: NVIDIA-Logo-3.3.png DATA SCIENCE Accelerating Apache Spark 3.X Leveraging NVIDIA GPUs to Power the Next Era of Analytics and AI Apache Spark is a powerful execution engine for large-scale parallel data
content:
[

http://www.nvidia.com https://nvda.ws/2Cd4Bf1 Accelerating Apache Spark 3.X Leveraging NVIDIA GPUs to Power the Next Era of Analytics and AI Apache Spark is a powerful execution engine for large-scale parallel data processing across a cluster of machines, which enables rapid application development and high performance. With Spark 3.0, big improvements make it possible to use the massively parallel architecture of GPUs to further accelerate Spark data processing. Download our free ebook to learn more about: - The data processing evolution, from Hadoop to GPUs and the NVIDIA RAPIDS™ library - Spark, what it is, what it does, and why it matters - GPU-acceleration in Spark - DataFrames and Spark SQL - A Spark regression example with a random forest classifier - An example of an end-to-end machine learning workflow GPU-accelerated with XGBoost DOWNLOAD (https://nvda.ws/2Cd4Bf1) https://nvda.ws/2Cd4Bf1 FOLLOW US https://www.facebook.com/NVIDIAAI/ https://twitter.com/nvidiaai https://www.youtube.com/user/nvidia https://www.instagram.com/nvidiaai/ https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/18000077 https://blogs.nvidia.com/blog/category/deep-learning/ Privacy Center (https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/privacy-center/) | Contact Us (https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/contact/) © 2020 NVIDIA Corporation. subject: Essential Guide to Training Data: Best Practices for Machine Learning Projects
snippet: Appen logo The Essential Guide to Training Data Best practices for creating training data for ML projects There's a saying: "Garbage in, garbage out." It's common knowledge that every
content:
[

https://appen.com/ ** The Essential Guide to Training Data (https://visit.appen.com/WC-2020-EssentialGuidetoTrainingData_RegLP.html?utm_source=Paid&utm_medium=KDN) ------------------------------------------------------------ Best practices for creating training data for ML projects There's a saying: "Garbage in, garbage out." It's common knowledge that every machine learning solution needs a good algorithm powering it, but what gets far less press is what actually goes into these algorithms: the training data itself. Your model is only as good as the data it's trained on. Pulling from over 20 years of experience, we break down how to approach training data, starting with raw data and annotating and labeling it so that it can be used to power the most ambitious projects. In the Essential Guide to Training Data (https://visit.appen.com/WC-2020-EssentialGuidetoTrainingData_RegLP.html?utm_source=Paid&utm_medium=KDN) we cover everything you need to know about creating the training data necessary to drive successful machine learning projects, including: * Why having a lot of big data isn't the same as having labeled data * How to determine which labels to use to evaluate your success * Where to find some great open datasets to bootstrap your model Download the ebook today (https://visit.appen.com/WC-2020-EssentialGuidetoTrainingData_RegLP.html?utm_source=Paid&utm_medium=KDN) When your goal is to launch world-class AI, Appen's reliable training data gives you the confidence to deploy. subject: Subsurface - the cloud data lake conference - 3 talks you won't want to miss (online)
snippet: July 30, 2020 REGISTER NOW Join Us Live at the Industry's First Cloud Data Lake Conference Hear firsthand from open source and technology leaders at companies such as Netflix, Expedia, Preset,
content:
[

wave July 30, 2020 REGISTER NOW (https://subsurfaceconf.com/summer2020?utm_medium=online-ad&utm_source=kd-nuggets&utm_term=na&utm_content=kd-nuggests-email-2020-07-20&utm_campaign=2020-subsurface-summer) wave Join Us Live at the Industry's First Cloud Data Lake Conference Hear firsthand from open source and technology leaders at companies such as Netflix, Expedia, Preset, Exelon, Microsoft and AWS about their experiences spearheading open source projects and building modern data lakes. Explore real-world use cases, from data warehousing and BI to data science and advanced analytics. This event is virtual, 100% LIVE and open to everyone, everywhere-at no cost. Speakers Daniel Weeks Daniel Weeks Big Data Compute Team Lead, Netflix and Parquet Committer and Hive Contributor Netflix Raghu Prabhu Raghu Prabhu Global Manager, Data Lakes, Big Data and Analytics, AWS AWS Tomasz Tunguz Tomasz Tunguz Partner, Redpoint Ventures Redpoint Adrian Woodhead Adrian Woodhead Principal Data Engineer, Expedia Expedia Raji Easwaran Raji Easwaran Group Program Manager, Azure Data Lake Storage Microsoft Azure Tomer Shiran Tomer Shiran Co-founder and Chief Product Officer, Dremio Dremio Wes McKinney Wes McKinney Director, Ursa Labs and Pandas Creator and Apache Arrow Co-creator URSA Labs Christine Mathiesen Christine Mathiesen Software Engineer, Expedia Expedia Maxime Beauchemin Maxime Beauchemin CEO & Founder, Preset and Apache Superset and Airflow Creator Preset Julien De Dem Julien Le Dem Co-founder and CTO, Datakin and Apache Parquet Co-creator Datakin Billy Bosworth Billy Bosworth Chief Executive Officer, Dremio Dremio Yannis Katsanos Yannis Katsanos Head of Customer Data Science, Excelon and Apache Parquet Co-creator Exelon wave Top 3 Reasons to Attend 1. Become an expert Learn how to build fast, cost-efficient cloud data lakes Explore real-world use cases with Microsoft, Moody's and others Get live 1:1 demos from leading technology vendors 2. Innovate with open source Dive into innovative open source projects such as Apache Arrow, Iceberg, Parquet and Superset Hear from project creators and key contributors at Expedia, Ursa Labs and Netflix 3. Join the community Network with industry experts and community leaders Share best practices with your peers Be a part of the cloud data lake community and continue collaborating after the conference Sound interesting? Sign up-there's no cost. REGISTER NOW (https://subsurfaceconf.com/summer2020?utm_medium=online-ad&utm_source=kd-nuggets&utm_term=na&utm_content=kd-nuggests-email-2020-07-20&utm_campaign=2020-subsurface-summer) wave Cool Swag for First 1,000 Attendees The first 1,000 attendees who log in to the LIVE event (not just register) will receive a cool, soft cotton Subsurface T-shirt and Swag box. Who Subsurface Is For Subsurface is a technical conference tailored for data architects and data engineers-the data teams on the front lines building next-generation cloud data lakes. The conference is also relevant for data warehouse administrators, infrastructure engineers and technically minded cloud data lake decision-makers. wave LEARN MORE (https://subsurfaceconf.com/summer2020?utm_medium=online-ad&utm_source=kd-nuggets&utm_term=na&utm_content=kd-nuggests-email-2020-07-20&utm_campaign=2020-subsurface-summer) wave Don't Miss the Cloud Data Lake Conference of the Year wave This email was sent to Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com (mailto:Markus.mueller.ds@gmail.com) why did I get this?
